type.name: section
type.title: Oath of Office.
type.context: PROMISSORY OATHS ACT under Oath of Office. 3. The oath referred to in this Act as the oath of office shall be in the form set out in the Schedule to the Constitution.
type.description: The oath referred to in this Act as the oath of office shall be in the form set out in the Schedule to the Constitution.

type.name: section
type.title: Officers to take oath of office.
type.context: PROMISSORY OATHS ACT under Officers to take oath of office. 4. The oath of office shall be tendered to, and taken by each of the officers named in the Schedule, as soon as may be after his acceptance of office:  Provided that when any person is appointed to act in the place and during the absence of any officer named in the Schedule, he shall not be required to take any oath on the occasion of such appointment, unless the oath required to be taken in respect of such appointment is different from or in addition to any oath already taken by him and duly recorded in respect of any previous appointment, permanent or temporary.

type.context: PROMISSORY OATHS ACT under Form of oath to be taken by Secretary to the Cabinet. 5.  The Secretary to the Cabinet shall take the oath of office before entering upon the duties of his office.
type.description: The Secretary to the Cabinet shall take the oath of office before entering upon the duties of his office.

type.context: PROMISSORY OATHS ACT under Before whom oaths to be taken. 6. (3) Any other oath required to be taken under this Act or any other written law shall (save where that other written law provides that the oath shall be taken before a person other than the President) be taken before the President or before such Minister, Judge of the Supreme Court of Judicature or such public officer as the President may in any case direct in writing under his hand, and the person before whom such oath is taken shall attest the same. type.name: section
type.title: Record of oaths.
type.context: PROMISSORY OATHS ACT under Record of oaths. 7. Every oath sworn in pursuance of this Act shall be recorded in some book to be kept for the purpose, by the signature of the person taking such oath, with the attestation of the person before whom the same is taken; and such book shall be conclusive evidence for all purposes of any oath therein recorded having been duly taken and recorded.

Any officer specified in the Schedule who declines or neglects when any oath required to be taken by him hereinunder is duly tendered to him, to take oath, shall, if he has already entered on his office, vacate it, and if he has not entered on it shall be disqualified from entering thereon; but no person shall be compelled, in respect of the same appointment to the same office, to take an oath or make an affirmation more than once.  ___________________  LAWS OF GUYANA 6 Cap. 27:06 Promissory Oaths  L.R.O. 1/2012 ss. 4,
